p: Close derivatives of alpha-linolenic acid are two acids included in the minor polyenoic acids group [ 75]. Rumelenic acid ( cis-9, trans-11, cis-15-octadecatrienoic acid) is formed by the isomerization of alpha-linolenic acid, while cis-9, trans-11, trans-15-octadecatrienoic acid is the isomer of rumelenic acid. Both acids are found in ruminants, for example in sheepâ€™s milk [ 69, 75].
